channel.title: Projects on Bradley Simon
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Bradley Simon

item.title: Bollywood Filmfare Awards
item.description: CWLData <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/brsimon2/Bollywood_Filmfare/master/Filmfare-Awards.csv") Graph 1 library(tidyverse) library(scales) Box_Office_IMDBRating <- CWLData %>% group_by(IMDB.rating) %>% summarise(Total_Box_Office = sum(as.numeric(Box.Office.Earnings.in.Rupees), na.rm = TRUE)) ggplot(data = Box_Office_IMDBRating, mapping = aes(x = IMDB.rating, y = Total_Box_Office)) + geom_smooth(color = "dodgerblue") + labs(x = "IMDB Rating", y = "Box Office Earnings in Rupees")+ scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) This graph shows that a higher IMDB rating does not necesssarily relate to more box office earnings. Graph 2 Box_Office_Month <- CWLData %>% select(Release.

item.title: NBA Social Influence
item.description: Dataset This dataset includes the on-court performance of 100 NBA players alongside their social influence and salary for the 2016-2017 season. The main measurement of social influence for this study is the number of twitter followers that a player has. Questions and Visualizations What is the relationship between a player’s salary and number of twitter followers? Do players that score more points also have more twitter followers? Is a player’s team related to the amount of social influence that they have?
